title: 1 dead, 4 injured in South Memphis shooting
content:
You need to have the Adobe Flash Player to view this content. Please click here to continue.
MEMPHIS, Tenn. — After a violent weekend in Memphis, police are investigating four separate shootings that left 10 people shot and one stabbed.
These shootings happened all over the city.
The most recent shooting happened at an apartment complex near Horn Lake and West Mitchell Roads.
A cap laid in the grass for hours, right next to a marker where police found a bullet. Feet away, another marker sat next to the 20th bullet officers found. But neighbors said they heard way more than that.
“I heard rounds of bullets," said one neighbor, who did not want to be identified. "Thirty to 40 shots, like assault rifle sounds.”
Five people were shot and one was killed at the Richmond Place Apartments early Sunday morning. Bullets flew as children slept in their beds.
“My son's window got shot out upstairs,” neighbor Ladesa Millbrooks said.
Luckily her son was not in his room that night; Millbrooks said she is thankful he was at his grandmother's house.
But that’s the only thing that made Millbrooks smile.
While police scoured her neighborhood, Millbrooks fought back tears. She told WREG the victim killed was sleeping in a car, waiting on friends when he was struck by a bullet.
“He will never wake up again," Millbrooks said. "That’s what’s got my heart. That could have been my son."
“I’m confused, I worked so hard,” said Frank Gottie, who grew up in the neighborhood.
Memphians normally see Gottie at anti-violence events. But this weekend, his message of peace hit hard when he received a call that two of his cousins were shot at the apartment complex.
“It makes me feel like I got to push harder and harder. I got to get out here with this bullhorn,” Gottie said.
Neighbors said the complex’s security gate hasn’t worked in quite some time. They said they are hoping something is done soon to keep families living here a little more protected.
One victim remains in extremely critical condition; three others are expected to be okay.
Police have not released any suspect information or said what led up to the shooting.
